title: Veliky Novgorod
summary: Veliky Novgorod (Russian: Великий Новгород, IPA: [vʲɪˈlʲikʲɪj ˈnovɡərət]), also known as just Novgorod (Russian: Новгород, lit. 'newtown'), is the largest city and administrative center of Novgorod Oblast, Russia. It is one of the oldest cities in Russia,[14] being first mentioned in the 9th century. The city lies along the Volkhov River just downstream from its outflow from Lake Ilmen and is situated on the M10 federal highway connecting Moscow and Saint Petersburg. UNESCO recognized Novgorod as a World Heritage Site in 1992. The city has a population of 218,717 (2010 Census);[9]
